attributes.action: HM Ships Albion, Bulwark to be funded by the foreign aid budget.
attributes.background: UK defense cuts include removal of these ships and crews. This will result in loss of jobs and the UK being unable to respond to disasters such as recent events in the Caribbean and the Far East. They should be fully crewed and retained as part of the MOD resources paid via our foreign aid budget.
attributes.additional_details: These ships have the capability of transporting and helping rebuild Infrastructure around the world in conjunction with UK business. They should fly our flag and project UK businesses and innovations. This would also give valuable experience for our troops in wining hearts and minds. Assisting other Nations and would give a positive image of our Military. This would also show the tax paying public that our foreign aid budget is being used in a more positive way. It could also promote UK trade.

attributes.action: Make the locking of school toilets during class time illegal.
attributes.background: It is an awful process for teenage females who require access to the nearest toilet and for everyone who has medical conditions that require quick access to the toilet. Also, using the toilet is a necessary process. Requiring to find a teacher is not appropriate!
attributes.additional_details: Finding an appropriate member of staff with a key is a time-consuming process and isn't fast. Therefore under 'The Workplace (Health, Safety and Welfare) Regulations 1992' - Regulation 21 #188 - 'Sufficient toilet and washing facilities should be provided to allow everyone at work to use them without unreasonable delay.' [http://www.hse.gov.uk/pUbns/priced/l24.pdf] and Regulation 21 #190 in the same Act, 'Facilities should be located so they are convenient...' I believe locking school toilets fails to meet the criteria and these same rights should be applied to students. Having to find a member of staff, without knowing where they would be, takes time and I, with many others, argue that it is an 'unreasonable delay'!

attributes.action: Cancel future cuts to the public health grant and return funding cut since 2015
attributes.background:
The public health grant funds prevention work through local authority public health departments to improve the health and well being of individuals and communities
Local authorities face a £331 million reduction to their public health budget, on top of a £200 million reduction announced in 2015.
attributes.additional_details:
*Every £1 spent on public health in UK saves an average of £14.
* cuts to the public health grant hinder preventative and health promotion work.
* Preventative programmes are essential to helping in levels of obesity and dental decay in children, increasing levels of exercise and  improving mental health and well being 
Past success in for example, reducing levels of smoking and teenage pregnancy show that it can work if resourced properly

attributes.action: Ban non-biodegradable plastics for single use items
attributes.background: Most single use plastics take over a century to decomposes which is causing a large issue when trying to dispose of it. Non-biodegradable plastics build up in our landfill sites, rivers and oceans affecting a number of bird and marine species. So why not just make single use plastics biodegradable?
attributes.additional_details:
Biodegradable plastics are a better alternative to non-biodegradable plastics because they can be recycled, reused and require less energy to produce.   
We must look to a better and more sustainable future,
Please sign this petition and let’s take action!

attributes.action: Stop the proposed changes to funding for refuges and short term housing.
attributes.background: These proposals will remove the only guaranteed funding for refuges from the welfare system. Effectively preventing vulnerable women from paying part of the cost of their accommodation in refuges with housing benefit resulting in mass closures of refuges.
attributes.additional_details: Funding for supported housing paragraph 68 on page 26 of the 58 page document details the proposed changes. Housing benefit currently meets about half of refuge funding resulting in closures of many.These changes withdraw all guaranteed funding for refuges for vulnerable women fleeing abuse putting them at further risk. Closures of refuges would result in enormous increased costs for alternative housing for local authorities.

attributes.action: Prevent the DVLA from selling personal information to outside companies
attributes.background: It has come to light that the DVLA are selling personal information to parking companies for the purpose of pursuing individuals in respect of alleged parking offences

attributes.action: Health care workers to have deaf awareness training/learn basic sign language
attributes.background: Deaf means deaf! Not hard of hearing! To often in hospital people who are deaf are treated as if they are hard of hearing/ hearing impaired.
attributes.additional_details: They are faced with healthcare professionals shouting from the end of the bed and missing out on vital decisions which are made due to poor and ineffective communication. This needs to stop, basic awareness should be incorporated in there training e.g. Writing down for the individual and confirmation of understanding. Not just relying on ineffective lip reading and poor hand gestures

attributes.action: Introduce an emergency alert text system nationally
attributes.background: The UK is now on the highest terrorist threat level, yet again. I personally believe it is unacceptable that our general public are not notified of horrific events that happen, endangering our safety. I believe a system should be introduced, like in the USA, alerting the public via text.
attributes.additional_details: It could also be used to alert the public of missing people, etc. I feel unsafe walking in city areas so close to people knowing the horrific events that happened recently. If people were to be alerted, it'd give them a better chance of evacuating the area. Theresa May says an attack is imminent, we CANNOT wait until another attack happens to take action. The system in the US uses phone masts to alert everyone who's connected in the area. The President can alert the whole country at once too.

attributes.action: Vaccinate badgers instead of culling
attributes.background: The Government have decided to extend the culling area and increasing deaths. This is based of little evidence and is destroying ecosystems. Why not just vaccinate them if it's a problem?
attributes.additional_details:
Also it is estimated that 6% of bTB cases amongst cattle are as a direct result of badgers, which is a small amount, so why not just vaccinate a few!
Sources:
https://www.badger.org.uk/can-the-cull

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-41228693

http://www.chesterstandard.co.uk/home/2017/09/13/gallery/wildlife-trust-is-opposed-to-badger-cull-in-cheshire-95089/

attributes.action: To increase the length of imprisonment for Voyeurism to a minimum of 2 years.
attributes.background: Victims who are put through this vile offence are life changing, physically and mentally. Their ability to trust is taken away & yet the offender will only receive a maximum of 2 years imprisonment - with a 3rd off if they plead guilty. This is not in anyway justice for victims.
attributes.additional_details:
Voyeurism is an offence under the Sexual Offences Act 2003.

This offence consists of somebody watching/filming victims doing a private act without their consent. This can then be distributed over fake porn sites, social media and across the internet for others sexual needs. 2 years is not justice!

A private act can be from bathing, using a toilet, anything you would deem as private and personal, and people do not deserve to have their privacy taken and publicly distributed without knowing.

attributes.action: The creation of Sedentary Behaviour Guidelines for the Early Years.
attributes.background: In today’s world there are many trends emerging, which mean children are starting in school underdeveloped physically, emotionally and mentally. We are calling for the government to create a set of Sedentary Behaviour Guidelines for the Early Years (aged 0–4 years) to help combat this.
attributes.additional_details: These national guidelines are in response to a call from health and health care professionals, child care providers, and fitness practitioners for guidance on sedentary behaviour in the early years. There is a strong relationship between sedentary behaviour (predominantly screen time) and health indicators (healthy body weight, bone and skeletal health, motor skill development, psychosocial health, cognitive development, and cardio-metabolic disease risk factors).

attributes.action: British Citizens must given the same rights as European citizens in the UK
attributes.background: ECJ human rights law must apply equally to EU Citizens and British citizens after March 2019. We can not allow a situation where British Citizens or European citizens living in the UK are treated as second class citizens after March 2019.
attributes.additional_details:
Brussels is pushing for the European Court of Justice to have a role in EU citizens' rights for 15 years after Brexit.

https://news.sky.com/story/ecj-role-at-heart-of-may-juncker-lunch-disagreement-11158741

Tory Brexiters set new red lines over ECJ and free movement

https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2017/dec/03/tory-brexiters-set-new-red-lines-over-ecj-and-free-movement

Theresa May says UK leaving EU court's jurisdiction

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-41012265

attributes.action: Publish all the rights of looked after children in one simple document.
attributes.background: Looked after children can be severely affected by discrimination, even though they have legal rights to protect them. These rights need to be published in one place to make it easy for those affected and social services to find so that they can be better enforced.
attributes.additional_details: The rights of looked after children are split between the Equality Act, the Children Act 1989, the Adoption and Children Act 2002, and the Children the Families Act 2015.

attributes.action: Require the prominent labelling of palm oil on all products sold in the UK
attributes.background: Palm oil plantations are the main reason huge tracts of rainforest are destroyed every day, releasing huge amounts of carbon into the atmosphere. Endangered species are being pushed towards extinction. Refined palm oil also contains large amounts of harmful fatty acid esters, known to cause cancer.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.rainforest-rescue.org/topics/palm-oil#start

http://www.saynotopalmoil.com/Whats_the_issue.php

https://www.theguardian.com/sustainable-business/ng-interactive/2014/nov/10/palm-oil-rainforest-cupboard-interactive

http://www.rainforestfoundationuk.org/palmoil

attributes.action: Every Knife sold through Retailers in the UK have tamper proof serial numbers.
attributes.background: Make our UK Streets safer for people and today's Youth. Every Retail purchase made by a person must produce ID , proof of address (much like a television for licensing purposes).This may significantly help police to save time and money and also to identify the perpetrator(s) leading to a conviction.
attributes.additional_details:
OBJECTIVE
-Licenced retail outlets allowed to sell knives and blades.
-Knives and blades to have concealed & tamper proof serial number.
-Registration of knives & blades via Metropolitan Police Website including Lost & Stolen.
-Photo ID, Proof of Address shown at point of sale. 
-CCTV installation means cases of identity fraud can be traced.
-Knives & Blades sold in sealed boxes - Not shelf sales.
-Ban on websites selling knives into the UK meaning a closed domestic market to Knife & Blade sales

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to increase leg room in public spaces when sat down.
attributes.background: There should be a minimum leg room space in places like cinemas and trains of 350mm from the edge of the seat of the chair to the back of the chair in front. This will improve the experience of all, especially for people of 1950mm height, the disabled, those with loads of luggage and children etc.
attributes.additional_details: It is really differcult for me, being of approx 1950mm high to sit comfortably on a train. I often have to sit at an angle which is not good for my back and my knees are always pressed up to the chair in front of me. Because I am twisted, it takes up space from the chair next to me and this reduces the space for anyone who sits next to me, which is annoying for both of us and embarrassing for me. Though this might lead to a slight reduction in seats on trains, it will improve the journey for all

attributes.action: Moped riders must have a full license. Not a provisional one.
attributes.background: Recently the number of mopeds thefts on main streets has increased drastically. This is primarily caused by teenagers on mopeds snatching phones while riding. This is enhanced by the fact that to get a moped you only need to have a provisional license which is exceedingly easy to obtain.
attributes.additional_details: The number of thefts in London has skyrocketed in recent years. Within the twelve months leading up to June 2017 the metropolitan police recorded 16,158 thefts on mopeds alone. The majority of these thefts is by teenagers with learner plates; who require no experience or background checks before being able to ride. We propose that all people wishing to obtain a moped require a full license.

attributes.action: To alter the trade description act so as to include new build homes
attributes.background: We would like tighter regulations in statute to enforce what is sold off plan and what is built. This should include updated quantifiable building standards with fixed time limits to rectify issue / problems with new builds. This will be enforced by daily fines, similar to over runs on the railways
attributes.additional_details: There is a ground swell of people who have been and still are facing unfair treatment due to wholly or outdated regulations. It is time UK law supported UK people not large companies.

attributes.action: Drivers who kill should face life sentences
attributes.background: My son was involved in a RTA and died at the scene. We think that how long the person gets for death by dangerous or careless driving under the influence of drink, drugs or mobile phones is wrong and believe this should be a life for a life sentence.

attributes.action: Make feminine hygiene products free for women.
attributes.background: How much money do we need to spend on something we can't help but need? Condoms are free from clinics, why shouldn't sanitary towels and tampons be? It's a disgrace and it needs addressing! We can't keep ignoring it. It's real and it's wrong.
attributes.additional_details: We shouldn't be paying for something our bodies need. It's a disgrace. I'm sure no woman on the planet likes the menstrual cycle. It should be free. We need to address this and actually do something about it. Stop ignoring it and accepting it - it's WRONG. It would be free if it were men that needed them. We need to fight this!

attributes.action: Commit to increasing the size of the Royal Navy by at least 20% over 50 years
attributes.background: Historically, the Royal Navy was the best in the world. Now, it's barely in the top ten. We need to be secure, it's not a luxury but a requirement. While the existing fleet is well equipped, there aren't enough ships to be everywhere needed. 20% in 50 years isn't a huge increase, but it's a start.
attributes.additional_details: The Royal Navy currently has under eighty commissioned ships. Only 3/4 of those are operational at any one time. These numbers are too small, especially compared to the 430 ships of the US Navy or the nearly 500 ships of China. In 1945 at the end of the Second World War, the Royal Navy had 900 ships, today's navy is less than 1% the size of then. We don't need to increase back to wartime levels, but we do need to increase the Navy's size considerably.

attributes.action: Rejoin the European Union in April 2019
attributes.background: The European Union consists of over 20 nations working to make a better life both for their citizens, and for the whole world. It offers fantastic trading opportunities as the largest free-trade area in the world. The international status and prestige of the UK would be enhanced by membership.
attributes.additional_details:
In June 2016 the people of the UK voted to leave the European Union. The government has repeated stated that it will respect this, and the the UK will leave the European Union, it will not debate whether the will of the people has changed, nor will it consider a referendum once the details of how the UK leaves become clear.

This petition proposes that the UK will leave the European Union. It will not rejoin by the back-door. We will join as any nation, with full public oversight.

attributes.action: Enforce all dog groomers must be qualified & registered under a regulating body.
attributes.background: I have recently had a terrible experience with a dog groomer,when investigating who I needed to report her too I realised that there is no one! no qualifications are needed and no regulating body to be accountable to. Please sign this petition,  together we can make a difference for our dogs.
attributes.additional_details: I spoke to the animal welfare who told me there is nothing anyone could do and the rspca wouldn't be interested! My dog is a teddy bear looking Lhasapoo with gorgeous teddy bear paws sadly he has now  been completely shaven, almost to the skin,she has even cut him on his chest and he has lost his whiskers.he was terrified when I picked him up. We really need the law to be changed and for all dog groomers to be qualified and accountable to a regulating body so this can not happen again to others.

attributes.action: Make measuring & public reporting of emissions by companies compulsory
attributes.background: Urgent action is needed to fight climate change (UN). Air pollution is responsible for 1 in 8 deaths worldwide (WHO). By making it compulsory for companies with a 500k£+ turnover to measure & report publicly reductions in their emissions we will progress much sooner towards meeting UN SDG Goal 13.
attributes.additional_details:
1) "Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts" United Nations Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) 13 (http://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/climate-change-2/)
2) "Air polution causes 1 in 8 dealths. If is the single biggest environmental crisis we face" World Health Organization (http://www.who.int/sustainable-development/news-events/breath-life/en/)

attributes.action: Demand an apology and a retraction of Trump's interference in British politics.
attributes.background: President Trump has given comfort to a far right, violent, British political party by re-tweeting their racist lies. Our government should summon the US Ambassador to inform him that interference in British politics in unacceptable and to demand an apology and a retraction.
attributes.additional_details: See http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-42166663

attributes.action: Stop all anonymous telephone calls and ban virtual telephone numbers.
attributes.background:
Householders across the UK are plagued by unsolicited telephone calls, which are increasingly automated. The majority of these calls arise from either with-held numbers or virtual numbers. 
The Government should make it illegal for Telephone Service Providers to pass on such telephone calls.
attributes.additional_details:
It is a simple matter for telephone service providers to identify both of these types of call and to prevent them from being put through to households; indeed, some companies will do this, at a price; effectively colluding with the "cold callers" to increase telephone service provider profits.
It is difficult to imagine a legal need for anyone to with-hold their telephone number or to pretend that they are calling from somewhere else, both of which actions are a deception.

attributes.action: Magazines legally required to disclose when models have been photoshopped.
attributes.background:
1.6 million people in the UK suffer from eating disorders. I believe some of this comes from the high pressure placed on women and men to be thin and toned.
One main source of this is because of the beauty standards upheld in our magazines. Women and men are photo shopped into the "perfect" figure.
attributes.additional_details:
There is such a high pressure on people to fit into the mould that is projected through magazines. This mould for women is thin, toned, bid breasts, big bum and perfect skin. For men the mould is lean and muscly, six-pack and a large package. 

Pictures in magazines cannot be something people aspire to be because they aren't real body expectation. 

France has already introduced this law to help defeat eating disorders and promote a healthy body image, I believe we should too.

attributes.action: Formally identify Accident and Emergency Departments as a UK Emergency Service
attributes.background: Nurses and Doctors working in Accident and Emergency departments deal with life and death on a daily basis. They are currently not seen as an "Emergency Service" in the UK along with Police, Ambulance, Fire or Coastguard.
attributes.additional_details:
1) Formally identified as an emergency service by the government.

2) Sentencing guidelines to be amended to show an offence of assault against any member of staff working in the accident and emergency setting (including other staff assessing patients in the accident and emergency setting) to be shown as an aggravating factor in the Magistrates Sentencing Guidelines.

3) To make an amendment to the Emergency Workers Act 2006 to include Accident and Emergency department workers.

attributes.action: Reduce Civil Court Fees to enable access to justice.
attributes.background: The Court Service made £100 million profit. The maximum court fee remains £10,000 to bring a claim and £1,090 to have a trial. Its time for the MOJ to review court fees to ensure we maintain access to justice for all.
attributes.additional_details: You are owed £220,000. You have some modest savings and need to issue court proceedings to recover your debt. You will have to pay a £10,000 court fee plus £1,090 to have a trial. There is no legal aid available anymore. You are prevented from bringing a claim simply due to the ridiculously high court fee.

attributes.action: Repeal the ‘Licensing Act 2003’ and restore the ‘Licensing Act 1921’
attributes.background: Binge drinking has become a huge cultural problem in the UK in our towns and cities. People’s selfish behaviour accounts for 12 - 15% of attendances at emergency departments due to acute alcohol intoxication. This peaks to about 70% on Friday, Saturday nights, Christmas Eve and New Years Eve.
attributes.additional_details: Return to older licensing laws where “on” and “off” premises sales of alcohol be restricted to 9 hours in the metropolis, 8 and a half hours elsewhere and 5 hours on sundays and bank holidays. The “Licensing Act 1921” requires a two hour interval and opening hours were 11am - 11pm in London and 11am - 10pm elsewhere. This will create a culture change and reverse some of the ill effects of the liberalisation of the licensing act in 1988.

attributes.action: Make rail companies guarantee a guard or security person is on every train.
attributes.background: Merseyrail is to introduce new Driver-Only Operated trains. They only guarantee to have a second person on trains after 8 pm. Many antisocial and criminal incidents take place at other times of day. Trains should have a second person patrolling to maintain order, check tickets and help passengers.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2014, Merseyrail spokeswoman Alice Owen said: “The safety of passengers is Merseyrail’s absolute priority,..." (reported in Liverpool Echo). This cannot be achieved without personnel on trains to ensure passenger safety.

If a passenger operates the alarm handle, there needs to be someone available to render assistance. The driver cannot do this. Without a second person on the train, the driver would have to go to the next station before stopping the train. This could make matters worse.

attributes.action: Everyone breeding puppies must have a licence linked to the puppy's microchip.
attributes.background: Dog breeders must all obtain a licence to breed. All litters and puppies should be listed onto a national database. All puppies must carry the licence details linked to their chip. No puppy should be sold without a chip, a licence certificate and a national database number.
attributes.additional_details: If this system were introduced then linked to a (heavily reformed) Dangerous Dogs Act and a health monitoring system, breeders who persistently bred litters with poor temperaments or health problems could be identified and have their licences revoked. In one fell swoop this would put puppy farmers out of business almost overnight, help to solve the problem of health defects being bred into or promoted in some breeds and improve the quality and temperament of puppies for family pet homes.

attributes.action: Change the NHS guidelines asking people their sexual orientation
attributes.background:
In April of 2019 the NHS guidelines will be changed requiring nurses and doctors etc to ask people their sexual orientation no matter what their appointment is about. 

This is wrong as it is personal information and should only be needed if required. Please don’t let this happen.

attributes.action: Double the mandatory sentence for possession of a Firearm
attributes.background: The UK and specifically urban inner city areas are blighted by gun crime. Murders, injury shootings and possesssion of Firearms (Section One) are increasing. The mandatory sentence for possession of such a Firearm at the moment is 5 years.Doubling this to 10 years would provide a massive deterrent.

attributes.action: End bedroom tax for bereaved parents/carers on the room of their deceased child
attributes.background:
Bedroom tax on the room of a deceased child is unfair, no parent wants an empty room for this reason.
My daughter passed away 2.5 years ago and I haven’t unpacked her hospital bag. I couldn’t imagine being forced to pack up her belongings and move away from the home that holds our memories.
attributes.additional_details:
Bedroom tax comes into effect a year after the child’s death, if the parent is claiming housing benefit.
A year is a short period of time after the loss of a child to then endure the stress of extra financial commitments.
Some parents may feel unable to work due overwhelming grief, PTSD or other reasons. 
Penalising them for their child’s death or making them move before they are ready will only cause more distress.
It is a cruel tax placed on people who are already suffering unimaginable pain.

attributes.action: Govt to increase funding for UK space programme, launch technology and spaceport
attributes.background: With the recent successful launch of the Electron rocket, developed in and launched from New Zealand, the UK is at risk of being left behind in the development of space tech. This petition calls on the Government to expedite and properly fund UK space ambitions including Skylon and a UK spaceport.
attributes.additional_details:
-UK Space Agency funding for 2016/17 was £371 million which is 0.05% of £772 billion total govt spending in the same year.
-Small nation of New Zealand successfully developed Electron rocket satellite launcher.
-Spin-off technologies associated with space programmes will benefit UK economy with high-tech jobs.
-21st century race for low-cost launchers, UK at risk of being left behind by other countries.

attributes.action: Introduce Suicide Bereavement Support to the NHS Services
attributes.background: We want more services and support for Suicide Bereavement via NHS Services. Currently, there is no such service and people are likely to be referred to bereavement counselling or SOBS. Suicide is on the rise, those of us who have been bereaved in this way struggle to find support or support groups.
attributes.additional_details:
My brother committed suicide in May 2016, it left everybody devastated and changed our lives forever and in unimaginable ways.  Unable to find help with her doctor, my Mum found a SOBS group in her region, however, the meetings are once a month and the group in this region has since closed.  Who else can my Mum and others affected talk to?

Suicide bereavement is something you will never understand until you have experienced it, as said, it’s life changing and you are left isolated with so many thoughts and emotions to cope with.

We have started a Facebook Group for Suicide Bereavement UK and every new person that joins have not been able to find the right support and can be left feeling suicidal themselves.

attributes.action: Force manufacturers to use recyclable packaging instead of taxing consumers
attributes.background: Yet another "tax" on consumers is being considered to deal with packaging waste (proposal to add 20p to cost of takeaway coffee), following the 5p levy on carrier bags.The problem lies with manufacturers and retailers who should be forced to develop and use completely recyclable packaging materials.
attributes.additional_details: Expecting consumers to pay for the cost of recycling packaging is unfair.  We have no say in what packaging is used by manufacturers and retailers and the amount of waste which is recycled varies from authority to authority.  In many shops in Germany, bins are provided at the checkouts for unwanted packaging.  Recycling is never going to increase if the onus is placed on consumers rather than manufacturers and retailers.

attributes.action: Open up the Help to Buy ISA scheme to those who have previously owned property
attributes.background: Currently if you have previously owned a property you are not eligible for the Help to Buy ISA scheme whereby the government will boost your savings by 25%. This means that people who have lost their homes (often single parent families) are not offered the same support as first time buyers.

attributes.action: Make it a Law for ALL Councils to log/record any Deceased/Injured cats !
attributes.background: When my cat went missing 24th Nov 17, I was told by the council that they do NOT log cats found, I want a system to be made compulsory, whereby a record is kept of cats found deceased or injured. I was informed that most are thrown into garbage vehicles and treated as rubbish. THIS HAS TO STOP !
attributes.additional_details: Most owners call their local council asking if their beloved furbaby has been picked up by street cleaners/bin men etc. My local council advised me that while a few caring street cleaners will kindly take a cat to the nearest vet, most do not and heartlessly dispose of them without a thought, leaving devastated owners needlessly searching for their family pet. With the huge news at present about cruelty/mutilation towards cats, its imperative to record these pets for possible investigations.

attributes.action: Teach LGBTQ sexual education in schools and about other sexuality's.
attributes.background: Within schools teaching LGBTQ sexual education is not on the curriculum, leaving those who are homosexual without the correct education that they need to have healthy and positive sexual experiences, with many contracting diseases. The spectrum of sexuality's are also left open for stereotyping.
attributes.additional_details:
The GLSEN 2013 National School Climate Survey found that fewer than five percent of LGBT students had health classes that included positive representations of LGBTQ topics.

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-33237995-for facts on sexually transmitted diseases for men

https://www.mentalhealth.org.uk/a-to-z/s/sexuality-for how mental health affects those on the spectrum.

attributes.action: Higher the tax free amount from £11500 to £15000
attributes.background: The Average family who works is struggling to make ends meet due to them being taxed. The inflation to normal living goes up every year but yet the tax free amount remains the same at £11,500 when the average family needs to earn £15,000 a year to survive and remain off benifits.
attributes.additional_details:
£11,500 a year Is tax free which at this rate it equals roughly £958 a month. An average family will need to earn £288 a week to meet basic demands of live, if we was multiple this by 52 weeks it equals £15,000 which should be tax free.

The tax on the living is making it harder for families to make ends meet families are being forced to be on benefits which then this is making it harder for the working class. 

So if the tax free amount was higher this will help more people being able to live.

attributes.action: Urgently stop student loan sales which are happening now.
attributes.background: Despite the student loans crisis, on 31st October 2017, Jo Johnson MP said he was going ahead with the sale of student loans. If the loan sales go ahead, students' interest and loan payments will end up in the pockets of private investors. This marketisation of education needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details: Even though there are three unfinished government inquiries into student loans at the moment, Jo Johnson announced he was proceeding with the sale of student loans. Loan sales should be stopped until the inquiries are completed. Loan sales crystallize loan terms so it is difficult for students to benefit from improvements made to loan terms. Loan sales also expose the taxpayer and student borrowers to risk of footing the bill for warranties and indemnities for sale arrangers and investors.

attributes.action: Make illegal all cold calling telemarketing calls to UK phone numbers
attributes.background:
Almost all British Citizens have mobile phones near us at all times, and increasingly less control over who has our phone number

Unscrupulous companies call without prior permission, at any time of day or night, in order to sell us unwanted products or services. This behaviour should be outlawed
attributes.additional_details:
Telemarketing has existed in for almost as long as there have been telephones. Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telemarketing

In 2017, 94% of UK adults owned at least one mobile, and there were 26.4m landlines in the UK. Ofcom: https://www.ofcom.org.uk/about-ofcom/latest/media/facts

In 2014, 58% of surveyed companies used telemarketing to generate customer sales. dma.org: https://dma.org.uk/press-release/new-telemarketing-research-reveals-it-s-good-to-talk

In 2013, 85% of householders said they'd received a nuisance call on their landline, 17% complained. thisismoney.co.uk: http://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/news/article-2377639/Watchdog-launches-online-tool-reporting-nuisance-calls-texts.html

attributes.action: Stop the planned upgrade of the M6 between J2-4 until other works are complete.
attributes.background: It's has been announced that works are to begin on upgrading the M6 between J2-4 to "smart motorway". There are works ongoing between J1-2 on the M5 as well as M6 junction 16-19. These should be completed first.
attributes.additional_details: Journey times through the Midlands are already frustrating enough as it is with the amount of road work projects on going. The highways agency should not be allowed to begin another project in the region until they have completed the ones they have ongoing at the moment.

attributes.action: Review the impact of Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Act 2012
attributes.background: In 2012 the the Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of offenders Act (LASPO) was passed. LASPO has had a profound impact on legal aid within the UK making it harder for people to gain legal representation, leading to an increase in litigants in person & arguably preventing access to a fair trial.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information see: 

Amnesty International Report 2012: UNITED KINGDOM: CUTS THAT HURT: THE IMPACT OF LEGAL AID CUTS IN ENGLAND ON ACCESS TO JUSTICE.

attributes.action: Increase Fines and Points for Using a Mobile Phone while Driving
attributes.background: As it has been Proven today’s Fine and Points are Not Working, the Police have said so, we can Still see Drivers using them each time we go out, seeing this Kills as Proven the Law needs to be much stronger, we have nearly been hit by a lorry being steered by one hand and coming over our side.
attributes.additional_details: These Drivers have not Learned anything by the last increase, White Vans seem to be the Worst offenders, Lives must be Protected on our roads from their actions, it may be a good idea to Increase the Points so that they could loose their Jobs to make them think, it’s No good after the fact where others are Injured or Killed, let’s Stop the Idiots that ignore the Laws.

attributes.action: Change the way in which eligibility for child benefit is calculated for couples.
attributes.background: Currently eligibility for child benefit for couples is calculated on the highest earners salary and taxable benefits.  Basically the higher earner is accountable for taxes if earning over 50k regardless of the salary of the lower earner.  For couples with one higher earner the formula is unfair.
attributes.additional_details: A couple with 2 incomes of 49k combined 98k inclusive of taxable benefits will be entitled to full child benefit and no taxation on either earner.  Where as for a couple with one higher earner for example 58k incl taxable benefits and one lower earner say 6k combined 64k.  Would still be entitled to child benefit however the higher earner would be subject to taxation.  For a family with 3 children the benefit would be 2.5k/yr with tax of 2.4k/yr.  This simply is not fair and needs reform.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all mainline train services to carry a defibrillator
attributes.background: Carrying defibrillators on trains could save lives. This should be made compulsory.

attributes.action: Introduce a maximum wage as a factor of the lowest paid employee's wage.
attributes.background: Wage gaps have got out of hand, meaning top earners are paid a ridiculous amount more then entry level staff. Often on a false pretense that hugh salaries attract the best candidates.  It just attracts the greedy.More people are struggling to make ends meet due to inflation driven by a skewed.
attributes.additional_details: impression of growth The average salary is distorted by excessively high wages while most people barely get by. This has driven up day to day living costs while every day workers buying power has decreased. A cap on how many times the lowest salary a company's top salary is would drive up that bottom salary and make wage distribution fairer, would equalise the housing market and boast the economy much more than 99% of money being in the hands of 1% of people.
